Description: Fragment of body of Attic pottery black-figured closed vase. Inside reserved; outside, lower part of female striding to right in the background, on the far side of a chariot team; parts of five hind legs of chariot horses remaining; the diagonal band in added red on the upper left may be part of a chariot pole or a stripe on a garment.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably from the same vase as J58a. Probably an excerpt from a Gigantomachy scene. Heidelberg, Antikenmuseum I52-I77 and I85-I92 have in the past been erroneously known and cited as J52-77 and J85-92.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg IV / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Deutschland Heidelberg, Universität (p.50 pl. 165.13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0907)
